questions.question_text: Which three options are the remote log storage options you can configure on FortiGate? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
Study Guide – Logging and Monitoring – Remote Logging – Log Storage-Remote.

If storing logs locally does not fit your requirements, you can store logs externally. You can configure FG to store logs on syslog servers, FortiCloud, FortiSIEM, FortiAnalyzer or FortiManager. These logging devices can also be used as a backup solution.

Selected Answer: BCE
Correct:
B. FortiCloud
C. FortiSIEM
E. FortiAnalyzer

FortiGate Security 7.2 Study Guide (p. 185)
Ch. 05 Logging and Monitoring – Log Storage-Remote:

"You can configure FortiGate to store logs on syslog servers, FortiCloud, FortiSIEM, FortiAnalyzer, or FortiManager. These logging devices can also be used as a backup solution. Whenever possible, it is preferred to store logs externally."

https://ebin.pub/qdownload/fortinet-fortigate-security-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html

Selected Answer: BCD
BCE are corrects

Selected Answer: BCE
BCE Are correct

Selected Answer: BCE
BCE are corrects

Selected Answer: BC
B. HTTPS
C. SSH 

Reference and download study guide:
https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-security-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html
Correct answer B & C from exam questions.
Selected Answer: BC

questions.question_text: Which two protocols are used to enable administrator access of a FortiGate device? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C. The port1 and port2 default routes are active in the routing table.
D. The port3 default route has the highest distance. 

0.0.0.0/0 [distance/metric] via 192.168.1.2, wan1, [priority/weight]

Reference and download study guide:
https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-infrastructure-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html
C & D.
AC, should be the correct answer, port 3 has the lowest distance, not the high distance

Selected Answer: CD
Fortigate_Infraestructure pag 55-56

Selected Answer: CD
">" sign depicts the selected route
I think it should say: The port3 default route has the lowest distance.

comments.content: The distance is 20 and that's the highest (the metric of port 3 is 10 but that wasn't asked)
I agree, the metric is actually the lowest as it's 10. So yes the question is incorrectly worded i think

choices.D: The port3 default route has the highest distance.
choices.A: The port3 default route has the lowest metric.
choices.C: The port1 and port2 default routes are active in the routing table.
choices.B: There will be eight routes active in the routing table.

choices.D: It is required to modify a firewall policy using the CLI.
choices.B: It defines the order in which rules are processed.
choices.A: It changes when firewall policies are reordered.
choices.C: It represents the number of objects used in the firewall policy.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. It is required to modify a firewall policy using the CLI. 

Reference and download study guide:
https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-security-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html

Selected Answer: D
Fortigate Security Study Guide Page 135.

Selected Answer: D
Answer D
Policy IDs are just "labels" assigned to policies, they do not determine the seq order that they are executed by Fortigate.

Selected Answer: D

questions.question_text: Which statement about the policy ID number of a firewall policy is true?

discussion.content: A,B --> Fortigate Infrastructure 7.0 Study Guide Page 119

Selected Answer: AB
A. Operating mode
B. NGFW mode

FortiGate Infrastructure 7.2 Study Guide (p.90):
"NGFW mode is a per-VDOM setting."
"Operation mode is a per-VDOM setting. You can combine transparent mode VDOMs with NAT mode VDOMs on the same physical FortiGate."

Reference and download study guide:
https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-infrastructure-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html
answer is A & B.
page 130 of inf guide

Selected Answer: AB
Fortigate Infrastructure Study Guide Page "123": The picture show "CONFIGURED SEPARATELY, in each VDOM:"
*Operating mode (transparent NAT/route)
*NGFW mode (profile-based, policy-based)
*Routes and network interfaces
*Firewall policies
*Security Policies
A,B --> Fortigate Infrastructure 7.0 Study Guide Page 126

questions.question_text: Which two settings can be separately configured per VDOM on a FortiGate device? (Choose two.)
